lines.text: People ask, "Who are you?" We are their daughters, their sisters, their sons, their nurses, their mechanics, their athletes, their police. We're your doctors, your fathers, your politicians, your solidiers, your mothers, your friends. We live with you, we care for you, protect you, teach you, love you and need you. All we ask is that you let us.
Do you know what the most important thing is to an infantryman?
His Buddy. You can be my buddy and share my foxhole any time, Colonel.
Do you know why i never hugged my sons?
I did. I was afraid they would become homosexuals.
And you ended up with one anyway. At least it was only your daughter.

[after a short silence]
You missed so much.
Have you ever made eggs before?
What do you mean. I mean I'm quite a good cook when I put my mind to it.
No one ever makes scrambled eggs in a sauce can.
Are you kidding. It is the only way.
